Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
byte - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: BYTE Process
Screen.Label: Create a bytefile (8-bit precision) version of traces.
PATHNAME=
OPT_NORM =
AMPL_MAX =
TIM_BEG =
TIM_END =
SKIP_INIT =
NUM_DO =
NUM_SKIP =
TOT_DO =
HDR_FLAG =
OPT_HIST =

Help.Tip: Pathname for the output bytefile created by the BYTE process.
Help.Text:
byte - PATHNAME
Pathname for the output bytefile created by the BYTE process.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char*60
 
 The bytefile created by BYTE will be transfered to the sub-directory specified
 by PATHNAME.  Note that PATHNAME must include the desired filename for the
 bytefile.

Help.Tip: Option to scale samples by trace LAV or by a specified value.
Help.Text:
byte - OPT_NORM
Option to scale samples by trace LAV or by a specified value.
 
 Default = TR_LAV
 Allowed = TR_LAV
 Allowed = AMPL_MAX
 
 If OPT_NORM = TR_LAV, byte samples are normalized by individual trace so that
 the largest possible byte absolute amplitude for a trace is that trace's LAV.
 If OPT_NORM = AMPL_MAX, all byte samples are scaled so the largest possible
 byte absolute amplitude is the user-specified value AMPL_MAX.

Help.Tip: Amplitude for the largest possible byte sample value.
Help.Text:
byte - AMPL_MAX
Amplitude for the largest possible byte sample value.
 
 Default = 10.0
 Allowed = real>0.0
 
 If OPT_NORM = AMPL_MAX, all byte samples are scaled so the the largest
 possible byte absolute amplitude is the user-specified value AMPL_MAX.

Help.Tip: Start time for the bytefile traces.
Help.Text:
byte - TIM_BEG
Start time for the bytefile traces.
 
 Default = TSTRT for input traces
 Allowed = real>=TSTRT
 
 Starting time for the bytefile traces defaults to the TSTRT global for the
 input traces.

Help.Tip: End time for the bytefile traces.
Help.Text:
byte - TIM_END
End time for the bytefile traces.
 
 Default = EOT
 Allowed = real>=TIM_BEG
 
 Ending time for the bytefile traces defaults to the ending time for the
 input traces.

Help.Tip: Number of traces to skip initially in the DO-SKIP selection.
Help.Text:
byte - SKIP_INIT
Number of traces to skip initially in the DO-SKIP selection.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = int>=0
 
 The DO-SKIP trace selection method consists of initially skipping SKIP_INIT
 traces, then sequentially processing ("doing") NUM_DO consecutive traces
 and skipping NUM_SKIP consecutive traces until TOT_DO total traces are
 processed.

Help.Tip: Number of traces to process at a time in the DO-SKIP selection.
Help.Text:
byte - NUM_DO
Number of traces to process at a time in the DO-SKIP selection.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0
 
 The DO-SKIP trace selection method consists of initially skipping SKIP_INIT
 traces, then sequentially processing ("doing") NUM_DO consecutive traces
 and skipping NUM_SKIP consecutive traces until TOT_DO total traces are
 processed.

Help.Tip: Number of traces to skip at a time in the DO-SKIP selection.
Help.Text:
byte - NUM_SKIP
Number of traces to skip at a time in the DO-SKIP selection.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = int>=0
 
 The DO-SKIP trace selection method consists of initially skipping SKIP_INIT
 traces, then sequentially processing ("doing") NUM_DO consecutive traces
 and skipping NUM_SKIP consecutive traces until TOT_DO total traces are
 processed.

Help.Tip: Total number of traces to process in the DO-SKIP selection.
Help.Text:
byte - TOT_DO
Total number of traces to process in the DO-SKIP selection.
 
 Default = 1,000,000,000
 Allowed = int>0
 
 The DO-SKIP trace selection method consists of initially skipping SKIP_INIT
 traces, then sequentially processing ("doing") NUM_DO consecutive traces
 and skipping NUM_SKIP consecutive traces until TOT_DO total traces are
 processed.

Help.Tip: Header word denoting flagged traces.
Help.Text:
byte - HDR_FLAG
Header word denoting flagged traces.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH
 
 If HDR_FLAG = 0, then all traces are processed.  Otherwise, only traces with
 a flag set in header word HDR_FLAG are processed.

Help.Tip: Option for version of history to transfer.
Help.Text:
byte - OPT_HIST
Option for version of history to transfer.
 
 Default = CURRENT
 Allowed = ALL       (Transfers the entire history.)
 Allowed = BRIEF     (Transfers current and abbreviated old histories.)
 Allowed = CURRENT   (Transfers the current history only.)
 Allowed = NONE      (No history is transfered.)
 
 "OPT_HIST = ALL" is the most conservative choice but it may not be advisable
 for large projects due to the size of files produced.
 
 Currently the only implemented options are CURRENT and NONE.
 ALL and BRIEF will work the same as CURRENT.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
byte - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
byte - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
byte - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
byte - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
byte - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
byte - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
byte - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
byte - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
byte - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
byte - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
byte - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : BYTE
 Category   : io
 Written    : 1987-02-01   by: John Sinton
 Revised    : 2000-12-08   by: Tom Stoeckley
 Maturity   : production   2001-02-13
 Purpose    : Create a bytefile (8-bit precision) version of traces.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
  Byte creates an 8-bit reduced precision copy of the traces that are input to
  the process.  All header words are retained in the bytefile with no
  reduction of precision.  The bytefile is sent to a user-specified unix
  sub-directory.
 
  Typically, bytefiles are made for diagnostic purposes and are displayed in
  the CBYT application.
 
  Traces input to BYTE are unaffected by the process.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
  Additional flexibility can be obtained with BYTE by using SELECT
  prior to BYTE in the process sequence.  SELECT may be used in the regular
  mode or in "flag" mode.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                           REVISION HISTORY
 
 53. 2001-02-13 Stoeckley  Change wrapup flag.
 52. 2000-11-17 Stoeckley  Change warning message if globals change to an
                            almost-equal instead of an exact comparison.
 51. 2000-11-06 Stoeckley  Add warning message if globals change.
 50. 2000-10-06 Stoeckley  Add statement to use the ADDEXT module (previously
                            was implicit in PATHCHECK which has been changed).
 49. 2000-09-15 Stoeckley  Added PRINTIT[/NULL] to gui_def to eliminate EzGui
                            warning about help entries missing from layout.
 48. 2000-08-31 Stoeckley  Change output global formats to allow larger values
                            for DT and other globals; remove calls to
                            STRING_TO_UPPER in traps.
 47. 2000-06-27 Stoeckley  Add PRINTIT parameter for internal calls.
 46. 2000-05-17 Stoeckley  Change to NOT generate a fatal error when no
                            traces are written to the file.
 45. 2000-04-07 Stoeckley  Change to allow overwriting old temporary files;
                            change to output history only to the IPN of
                            this process; implement the use of the OPT_HIST
                            parameter.
 44. 2000-03-30 Stoeckley  Add current history to global file; add GUI
                            definition section.
 43. 2000-03-10 Stoeckley  Fix bug involving creating name of global file
                            when path begins with a period; change TIM_BEG
                            and TIM_END logic to use the TIMECHECK primitive;
                            fix bug regarding flagged traces (was saving the
                            unflagged instead of the flagged traces).
 42. 2000-02-21 Stoeckley  Change creation of temporary files so that more
                            than one BYTE process can be called internally
                            from the same process module.
 41. 2000-02-15 Stoeckley  Add insensitive flag for AMPL_MAX.
 40. 2000-02-02 Stoeckley  Fixed bug so that the wrapup routine works
                            properly when trace processing is not performed;
                            increase length of pathname parameter; delete
                            local files after successful rcp.
 39. 2000-01-24 Stoeckley  Fixed bug in call to BSWAP which was causing the
                            the code to abort when compiled with the Portland
                            Group compiler; move wrapup code (saving byte
                            files) to the wrapup subroutine.
 38. 2000-01-17 Vunderink  Removed outmoded documentation,modified to use
                           pathcheck primitive, fixed typo in error message,
                           and added RCS "Id" string
 37. 1999-10-20 Vunderink  Removed lowercasing of pathname
 36. 1999-09-13 Vunderink  Made parameter cache named constants changes
 35. 1999-06-24 Vunderink  Converted from old CPS system.
 34. 1998-01-14 Goodger    Add the name BYTE to error message about
                           no traces being written. Convert to fortran90
                           free form.
 33. 1996-07-02 Goodger    Abort job if no traces are written to byte
                           file.
 32. 1996-01-11 Vunderink  Change wording in history for easier parsing
 31. 1995-11-14 Vunderink  Replace FTPXFR file transfers with call to
                           CLOSFIL
 30. 1995-08-28 Vunderink  Replace dispose with call to CLOSFIL
 29. 1995-03-08 Goodger    Add parameter HF#.
 28. 1994-10-04 Goodger    Increase CMD array to 160 characters to allow
                           for the maximum number of characters in an
                           ISHELL command.
 24. 1993-03-23 Troutt     If '"' occurs before ':' in unix filename,
                           assume user & password is there and use
                           dispose instead of FTPXFR.
 23. 1993-02-26 Cooper     Set protection of the files transfered by the
                           'dispose' command to (GROUP:RWED).This will
                           allow those in the same group to transfer file
                           to others in the group and the directory owner
                           will have priviledge to DELETE the files.
 22. 1992-09-23 Peterson   Use FTPXFR to transfer .glbl and .byt files if
                           node is TCP/IP supported and .netrc file exist
                           is execution account. If .netrc does not exist
                           BYTE uses dispose and the slower DECNET lines.
 21. 1992-05-01 Troutt     UNICOS NODE TRANSFERS- Changed string to look
                           for from "U/PTMP" to "PTMP/".
 20. 1992-04-08 Troutt     Clip byte values if actual LAV>RELMAX and warn
                           user.
 19. 1992-04-07 Troutt     Fix TRMAX for RELMAX>0.
 18. 1992-03-27 Peterson   New option 'RELMAX' with which to scale each
                           trace to retain relative amplitude rather than
                           each traces max. amplitude for normalization.
 17. 1992-03-18 Troutt     UNICOS NODE TRANSFERS- Changed string to look
                           for from "/U/PTMP" to "U/PTMP".
 16. 1991-08-15 COOPER     UNICOS NODE TRANSFERS-
                            FOR TRANSFERING A FILE TO A UNIX NODE
                            CHECK FILE NAME FOR /U/PTMP IN THE STRING
                            IF FOUND CHANGE STRING TO LOWERCASE AND
                            ADD A " AFTER FILE EXTENSION glbl
 15. 1990-11-28 Howard     UNICOS changes:
                             1. CALL DISPOSE --> ISHELL('dispose')
                             2. Close OUTFLG before dispose.
                             3. Can't mix formatted and unformatted I/O
                                on file OUTFLG--changed to all formatted.
                             4. Explicitely stated /RFM=VAR/MRS=80 on
                                dispose of OUTFLG.
 14. 1990-06-08 Bass       Put byte file name in history file.
 13. 1989-07-20 Sinton     Changed all APUTWA to PUTWA and moved WCLOSE.
 12. 1989-06-26 Hanson     Make BYTE internally callable, set ISAV=1.
 11. 1989-06-05 Sinton     Added call to BHISTS for history stuff.
 10. 1989-05-08 Sinton     Increased length of output header to 1040
                           characters max (corresponding change made to
                           IO_CRBF.FOR).
 9.  1989-03-02 Sinton     TRMAX for dead traces returned as 0.0 rather
                           than 127.
 8.  1988-10-07 Sinton     Corrected errors in trace headers.
 7.  1988-09-16 Sinton     NWIH conversion.
 6.  1988-09-16 Sinton     Added 3 new input parameters for history
                           processing and trace headers.
 5.  1988-04-23 Baumel     Add CPSPRT calls.
 4.  1987-06-10 Sinton     File conventions ok for multi-loop jobs.
 3.  1987-04-10 Sinton     Removed the NORM option and the %BYTDWA
                           file.
 2.  1987-02-27 Sinton     Modified from BYTE to produce a random
                           access file on the front end.
 1.  1987-02-01 Sinton     Original Version.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
